newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - U.S. Robotics falters.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - U.S. Robotics falters.

text.p: U.S. Robotics Corp shares weakened preceding Monday's market open as investors grew jittery over the prospect of rival Rockwell International Corp shipping millions of new microprocessors for high-speed computer modems, traders said.
Before the opening of the new trading week, U.S. Robotics fell to 66-1/2 from 68-1/2.
According to news reports, Rockwell intends to battle U.S. Robotics by shipping in coming months chips that allow modems to move data over telephone lines twice as fast as the current rate.
Rockwell shares made no moves before the market open.
Creative Technology Ltd Nasdaq-listed shares rose to 15-3/4 from 14-3/16 after the company reported better-than-expected second quarter results, traders said.
Creative, a Singapore-based maker of personal-computer multimedia products, said it earned $US0.64 per share, up from US$0.31 per share one year ago.
After the news, analysts said the earnings report boosted optimism in their forecasts for the company.
Rational Software Corp rebounded partially from Friday's decline with an assist from Goldman Sachs' adding the stock to the firm's recommended list this morning.
Rational traded at 26-5/8 early Monday, up from 25-3/8.
The stock fell 1-7/8 Friday, weakness traders said came from market speculation that there would be a delay in the release of Rational's latest software product.
Traders reported no early trades in Apple Computer Inc, though they expected the stock to move higher at the start of the regular session.
Apple, it was reported, is mulling the possible sale of key business units to step up cost cutting.
